name: basket-wave hat
sizes_available: 14 (16, 18, 20, 22)" / 35.5 (40.5, 45.5, 51, 56)cm to fit baby (toddler, child or adult s, adult m, adult l)
notes:
this hat does double-duty – one side has a basketweave motif, and the other side is awash in waves. 

**special thanks to annie maloney**
annie maloney is a magician with cables. she hosts a biennial blanket mkal, and one of the background stitches in her [starstruck sampler mkal][1] was the basketweave stitch used in this pattern. i was intrigued by how lovely the “wrong side” of the stitch was, and annie generously encouraged me to write up this hat pattern.

**sizes:**
sizes 1 (2, 3, **4, 5**) with brim circumferences of 14 (16, 18, **20, 22**)” / 35.5 (40.5, 45.5, **51, 56**)cm to fit baby (toddler, child or adult s, **adult m, adult l**). hat circumference should be 1.5-2.5” / 4-6.5cm smaller than head circumference.

**yarn:**
approx. 125 (150, 180, **200, 245**)yds / 115 (135, 165, **185, 225**)m worsted or aran weight yarn. *note:* yardage may vary based on specific yarn, gauge, and any modifications.

sample 1 used berroco ultra wool in sour cherry
sample 2 used cloudborn fibers limited edition wool worsted in ecru (now discontinued)
sample 3 used magpie fibers nest worsted in twilight magpie

**gauge** (after blocking)**:**
20 sts x 28 rnds per 4” / 10cm in stockinette
24 sts x 28 rnds per 4” / 10cm in 2x1 ribbing
24 sts x 32 rnds per 4” / 10cm in basket-wave

**needles:**
u.s. size 7 / 4.5mm or size to meet gauge
• for hat body, 16” / 40cm circular needle, or traveling loop, or dpns
• for crown shaping, magic loop or dpns

**notions:**
tapestry needle
stitch marker for bor


  [1]: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/starstruck-sampler-mkal
